poem:
Title: "Persistence through Morning's Frost"

Frost may fall on brave Ukraine,
Drones ascend from tyrant's reign.
Yet, courage dances unrestrained,
In every heart, freedom ingrained.

Down fall the iron birds of war,
Silenced by resolve's pure roar.
Christ's day shines on yonder shore,
Hope, a gift we can't ignore.

Though morning frost may chill the land,
Warm resilience in Ukraine stands,
Fierce and bold, a steadfast band,
In Liberty's light, they make their stand.
